description.narrative: (Democratic Republic of the Congo): .USAID will use FY 2020 funds to strengthen communities' ability to prevent and respond to gender-based violence (GBV), reducing GBV incidences and providing access to holistic care for survivors, including trafficked persons and other vulnerable groups. The activity provides medical, legal, psychosocial, and economic support services to survivors through Village and Savings and Loan Associations, and the training of social workers, psychologists, medical personnel, community-based organizations, first responders, and legal advocates. It invests in community awareness campaigns to promote women's rights and community acceptance of survivors. FY 2020 funds will include support for vulnerable and marginalized groups such as LGBTI persons affected by GBV and trafficking. Major activities using FY 2020 funds include provision of family planning commodities and services, Social and Behavior Change Communication, and Community Based Trauma Healing programs that shift community norms to adopt positive gender roles while reducing stigma and negative attitudes that prevent GBV survivor reintegration. Maternal and child health and family planning activities will strengthen the capacity of Congolese institutions and communities to deliver quality, integrated health services that sustainably reduce maternal and child deaths, combat infectious diseases and increase access to voluntary family planning. Assistance will promote self-reliance of government entities to ensure results are sustained over the long-term. ..GBV activities will make specific contributions to CDCS sub IR 3.3.3, "strengthened community-based prevention of and response to sexual and gender-based violence". It will be fully integrated across a range of USAID activities and engage multiple sectors to ensure optimal impact...
